title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of passengers using variables, cereal square as $$x$$ and nut as $$(30-x)$$.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each grain type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$4\left(x\right)+7\left(30-x\right)=6.5\times30$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug $$x$$ into the original relationship to find $$30-x$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is $$5$$ pounds of cereal squares and $$25$$ pounds of nuts.
